title: U12 TRANSITION – defensive third — CoachAI Balanced Youth Model (90m)

plan.rationale: This training plan focuses on building a foundation of attacking principles, transitioning effectively, and enhancing player decision-making under pressure.
plan.summary: Players will improve their ability to maintain possession, create goal-scoring opportunities, and react to transitions. Emphasis will be on quick decision-making and efficient movement.

drill.title: Dynamic Passing & Receiving
drill.objective: Improve passing accuracy, receiving technique, and peripheral vision.
drill.organization: Players in pairs, passing and receiving using different techniques (inside foot, outside foot, volley). Focus on head-up scanning before receiving. Gradually increase the distance and pace. Add a second ball to increase cognitive load.
drill.setup: Pairs, cones to mark distance, balls. Area: 20x20 yard grid.

tacticalCues: Nearest presses, second covers, third balances
Recover behind the ball on loss
modelInfluence.scoringBias: Defensive success: force wide, block, regain
constraintsToApply: Bonus if defending team forces play wide

drill.title: 4v4+4 Possession Game
drill.objective: Develop quick passing, support play, and create goal-scoring opportunities.
drill.organization: 4v4 inside a grid with 4 neutral players on the outside. The neutral players support possession. Focus on maintaining possession, finding penetrating passes to the neutral players and shifting the ball quickly. Teams score by passing to neutral players who then dribble across the end line.
drill.setup: Grid: 30x30 yards. Players: 4v4 + 4 neutrals. Duration: 3x8 minutes.
constraints: Neutral players can only pass once back into the grid.
progression: Add a defender to create overload and encourage quick decision making
Introduce a condition for scoring, such as two passes to neutral players before scoring.

tacticalCues: Nearest presses, second covers, third balances
Recover behind the ball on loss
modelInfluence.scoringBias: Defensive success: force wide, block, regain
constraintsToApply: Bonus if defending team forces play wide

drill.title: Transition to Goal
drill.objective: Improve quick transitions from defense to attack and finishing.
drill.organization: Team A starts with a pass to a forward. Team B attempts to win the ball and quickly counter-attack to score on the main goal. Team A defends the main goal. If Team A wins the ball, they attack the same goal. The focus is quick transition and decisive finishing.
drill.setup: Half field. Teams: 6v6 + GK. Cones to mark start. Duration: 4x7 minutes.
constraints: Focus on accurate shooting and finishing
progression: Allow counter attacks from all areas

tacticalCues: Nearest presses, second covers, third balances
Recover behind the ball on loss
modelInfluence.scoringBias: Defensive success: force wide, block, regain
constraintsToApply: Bonus if defending team forces play wide

drill.title: Dynamic Stretching and Review
drill.objective: Promote recovery and reinforce key learning points.
drill.organization: Light stretching. Review of session objectives, key technical points, and psychological aspects covered. Encourage player feedback.

tacticalCues: Nearest presses, second covers, third balances
Recover behind the ball on loss

constraintsToApply: Bonus if defending team forces play wide
